page.name: Share this quote with your learners
page.content:
Share the following quote from page 23 of the Additional Resource: Mindset and Reading Performance:

“Students with a fixed mindset, by contrast, may feel that effort and practice will not improve their reading ability or help them catch up to their peers; but, by contrast, if their mindset is malleable, these students may learn to persevere, and through effortful practice, their performance could improve.”

Ask the learners to "share and pair" — turn to their neighbor and share their responses to the following prompts with their neighbor.  

  • I have a fixed mindset about... because... 
  • I have a growth mindset when it comes to... because... 
  • I avoid or don't enjoy practicing when... 
  • I think... would help me improve my motivation for practicing reading/writing because... 

Go back to the Try It Yourself Section for a list of all Try it Yourself Options.
